intro.description: What you're about to see is a modest interface for searching books in Google Books resources.
intro.disclaimer: I am only the creator of the interface.
intro.responsibility: Therefore, I have no influence on the actual search results in the database, only on preparing and sending the query.
intro.presentation: And, of course, presenting the results.
intro.contentWarning: I'm writing about this because Google Books content has its pros and cons. First of all, Polish characters are used inconsistently.
intro.searchTip: Therefore, if someone is interested in Wiedźmin, they have to search twice: "Wiedźmin" and "Wiedzmin".
intro.versionNote: And this version of the app (the first one, by the way) doesn't support regular expressions, etc.
intro.tagsWarning: Besides, I don't encourage searching by tags. A minimal number of books have them and you can make quite a mess.
intro.authorTip: The "Author" field in the search treats the entered string as a complete word, so it's not enough to type "Mickiewi" to get acquainted with the Bard's legacy.
intro.conclusion: And that would probably be all.
intro.farewell: May the Force be with you!
intro.skipIntro: However, if you don't want to watch this intro cum mortum, click anywhere on it.
